BIO:
David was born and raised in Zimbabwe.
From and early age, he was fascinated with computers and technology, despite having limited access to them in a developing country.
He excelled at school and was one of a handful of candidates recruited straight after high school by Ernst & Young. He pursued his degree whilst working as a financial auditor, but soon transferred into the IT Audit & Assurance function once his computer proficiency was recognised.
There he developed his skills to focus on process auditing, technical security of infrastructure and data analytics services.
The downward turn in Zimbabwe's economy forced him to move into the private sector, where he served as IT Manager for a stockbroker and its subsidiaries for a brief period before taking a position offered by Ernst & Young (EY) in the United Kingdom.
David emigrated to the UK in 2006, where he rejoined EY for another 3 years. His skills in technical security auditing and data analytics were soon put to task again and he serviced a number of large public and private sector clients around the UK.
Seeking a new challenge, he left EY in 2009 to join British American Tobacco (BAT). Thanks to BAT's large global footprint, David discovered his love for travel and cultures as he travelled the globe to perform audits at the company's various locations in Asia Pacific, Europe, Africa and Americas.
Through those travels, David found love and began a long-distance relationship with his partner, who lived in Florida, US. After being together for three years, David decided to make it permanent and married his beloved, packing up his things in London and moving to the US in the process, where he now resides.
